subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_025D_01C9E848.63E1EDD0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Right...gotcha. Sound is a bi-product more or less.

  ----- Original Messa=
ge ----- 
  From: Frank Ratka 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Monda=
y, June 08, 2009 2:46 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas





        EM=
 waves at the VLF and ULF level can give off sound but only as a secondary =
phenomenon. It sounds like a low hum to some people! I believe the most fam=
ous of these phenomenon was caused by HAARP.

        --- On Mon, 6/8/09, A=
pril Abercrombie <april@...> wrote:


          Fr=
om: April Abercrombie <april@...>
          Subjec=
t: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
          =
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 3:43 PM


          So everything can be define=
d as from one of these forces. Objects from these forces can omit sound wav=
es.

          Does that sound like a correct statement? Just trying to get=
 my mind around it.

            ----- Original Message ----- 
            =
From: Rj 
            To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
            Sent: Monda=
y, June 08, 2009 2:33 PM
            Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


   =
               April, standard physics today defines four fundamental types=
 of forces: electromagnetism, gravity,  and the strong and weak interaction=
 of elementary particles.  So while EM is one type of energy (well, lets ca=
ll it a force), there are a few others too.


                  --- On Mon,=
 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


=
                    From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearc=
h. com>
                    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
              =
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                    Date: Monday, June 8=
, 2009, 1:21 PM


                    This seems to jive with what I have l=
earned this far, but I am still not certain I understand it completely.

  =
                  I thought everything was based in the electromagnetic spe=
ctrum.

                    ----- Original Message ----- 
                 =
     From: Frank Ratka 
                      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com =

                      Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 2:05 PM
                =
      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


                            Tell m=
e where the seperation on the spectrum takes place between 300Hz and 300KHz=
. Yes, soundwaves cause pressure waves that our ears read as vibration and =
our mind translates as sound. The waves are still on the electromagnetic sp=
ectrum. Even subsonic geomagnetic waves are present on the scale. What I me=
an by power can be directll translated to volume or amplitude. The only thi=
ng that distinguishes soundwaves from any other wave is the fact that we ca=
n hear them.

                            Frank R.

                       =
     --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


                =
              From: Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com>
                              =
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
                              To: EVP-ITC@=
yahoogroups .com
                              Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, =
2:53 PM


                                No. Sounds waves are not on the e=
lectromagnet spectrum nor are they a form of electromagnet energy. Sound wa=
ves are based on pressure waves in the air (or in other substances).  Our e=
ars detect these pressure waves and translate them into sounds we here.  Ou=
r ear do NOT hear electromagnet energy.  Our eyes do: that part which we ca=
ll visible light.



                                --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Fr=
ank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com> wrote:


                              =
  From: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com>
                             =
   Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
                                To: EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                                Date: Monday, June 8,=
 2009, 12:38 PM


                                It sounds like she's sayi=
ng "one, two, ....."

                                A mistake that a lot =
of people make is thinking that there are two different types of energy at =
work when it comes to sound waves and electromagnetic waves. The only thing=
 that seperates them is frequency and power. Radio waves are radio waves be=
cause they occupy a certain block of the electromagnietic spectrum. Sound w=
aves exist on that same spectrum just farther down with much longer waves. =
Soundwaves and subsonic waves can penetrate almost anything because of thei=
r wavelengths. The shorter the wavelength the more ways we can shield again=
st them.

                                Think of microwaves. These are al=
so a type of radio and telemetry transmitting wave but the waves also have =
a physical effect on our environment by causing molecules to speed up, whic=
h creates heat. A little lower than this is IR or infrared it too can cause=
 physical objects to heat up but usually it just causes molecules to rotate=
 in place. All physical things give off IR light. Its a way the total syste=
m conserves energy by spontaneously emitting IR radiation.

               =
                 Frank R.

                                --- On Mon, 6/8/=
09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


     =
                           From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ost=
research. com>
                                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New i=
deas [3 Attachments]
                                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroup=
s .com
                                Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:27 PM
=


                                Here is some food for thought. I am curre=
ntly reviewing my audio from our May 30th investigation.

                 =
               It was me and another girl teammate present in the room. I p=
icked up a 3rd female voice on my digital voice recorder that I carry with =
me. We were standing right next to another digital video recorder that I le=
ave beside my night vision camera. That recorder did not pick up this 3rd v=
oice. I have asked the girl that was with me to check her recording to see =
if she picked it up.

                                I have long felt the =
true EVP does not come from sound waves in the environment, or then it woul=
dn't be EVP, but a disembodied voice. Somehow EVP's are appearing directly =
on the recordings.

                                This instance with the =
recorders may back that theory up. That other recorder should have picked t=
hat voice up if it were sound waves in the environment.

                  =
              I am attaching the clip of this 3rd voice. The file that is n=
amed "01-02-17 Clip" is the full clip. You will hear my voice as I say "Yea=
h", and then another comes in right after that. I think I know what it says=
.

                                Again, I was live monitoring my audio, b=
ut still did not hear this until playback. It isn't clear, so I am not as e=
xcited about it as my one's from the last investigation.


                =
                ----- Original Message ----- 
                             =
   From: Frank Ratka 
                                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
ps .com 
                                Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:09 P=
M
                                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


      =
                          I have a running theory that EVP is carried on an=
 untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they want it to manifest. It=
 works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic waves that d=
iffer one another in frequency then if you add or subtract them together yo=
u get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For example, if a ghost is s=
ending a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room creating an=
 untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermediate difference=
 frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This w=
as just an example, but all electronic equipment generates ultrasonic signa=
ls just by turning them on. From this theory I always felt that EVP were ge=
nerated within a few inches of the recorder.

                             =
   We are able to reproduce this affect in not only radio with superheterod=
yne systems but also with acoustics and audio as in some passive sonars and=
 a commercial produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.

=
                                Frank R.

                                -=
-- On Mon, 6/8/09, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com> wrote:


             =
                   From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com>
                =
                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
                          =
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                                Date: Mo=
nday, June 8, 2009, 1:56 PM


                                Fascinating! =
I've had this idea that the EVP are often not recorded by the microphone bu=
t somehow make their way in at the actual point where the storage is made, =
whether it be analog (tape) or digital. 

                                S=
o much we don't know ...

                                Zack

           =
                      
                                On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 =
at 1:39 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:=





                                I monitor my audio live. The funny thi=
ng is that even so, those last EVP's I captured I did not hear either in th=
e environment, or on my recording as it happened. I only heard them upon pl=
ayback.

                                ----- Original Message ----- 
    =
                            From: Zack Widup 
                             =
   To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                                Sent: Mond=
ay, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM
                                Subject: Re: [EV=
P-ITC] New ideas


                                I am curious if anyone w=
ith a microphone wired to a remote site has ever gotten any EVP in real tim=
e.

                                I took part in an investigation of Ashm=
ore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had six video cameras s=
et up in the three halls of the building. The video for all was being monit=
ored and recorded at a central location. Alas, we did not have microphones =
at the camera sites conected to the central location. I wonder what we migh=
t have heard if we did?

                                Zack

            =
                     
                                On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 a=
t 12:05 PM, threadsintyme@ juno.com <Threadsintyme@ juno.com> wrote:


    =
                            Let's just agree to end this discussion about h=
er... 
                                Why don't we discuss something on a =
lighter note? Anyone have any new ideas about either evp or ITC? 
         =
                       Al

                                 

             =
                    

                                 

                  =

            =
                    but a disembodied voice. Somehow EVP's are 
           =
                     appearing directly on the 
                           =
     recordings.</FONT></DIV>

">This 
                                instance with the recorders may bac=
k that theory 
                                up. That other recorder shou=
ld have picked that 
                                voice up if it were so=
und waves in the 
                                environment.</FONT></DIV>=

vestigation.</FONT></DIV>

<TBODY>
                                <TR>
                              =
  <TD vAlign=3Dtop>
                                <DIV>I have a running t=
heory that EVP is carried 
                                on an untrasonic=
 wave and demodulated exactly 
                                where they w=
ant it to manifest. It works off the 
                                heter=
odyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic 
                               =
 waves that differ one another in frequency then 
                         =
       if you add or subtract them together you get a 
                    =
            beat frequency or alternate frequency. For 
                   =
             example, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz 
            =
                    and you have an electric fan in a room creating 
      =
                          an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will 
 =
                               have a intermediate difference frequenc=
y at 
                                9KHz, well within human hearing range=
 (20Hz to 
                                20KHz). This was just an example=
, but all 
                                electronic equipment generates u=
ltrasonic 
                                signals just by turning them on.=
 From this 
                                theory I always felt that EVP w=
ere generated 
                                within a few inches of the r=
ecorder.</DIV>
                                <DIV> </DIV>
          =
                      <DIV>We are able to reproduce this affect in not 
   =
                             only radio with superheterodyne systems but al=
so 
                                with acoustics and audio as in some pas=
sive 
                                sonars and a commercial produce calle=
d the 
                                "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pomp=
eii.</DIV>
                                <DIV> </DIV>
              =
                  <DIV>Frank R.<BR><BR>--- On <B>Mon, 6/8/09, Zack 
       =
                         Widup <I><w9sz.zack@gmail. com></I></B> 
   =

                             =
   <BLOCKQUOTE 
                                style=3D"BORDER-LEFT: rgb(1=

e: [EVP-ITC] New 
                                ideas<BR>To: EVP-ITC@yaho=
ogroups .com<BR>Date: 
                                Monday, June 8, 2009=
, 1:56 PM<BR><BR>
                                <DIV id=3Dyiv100209972>
 =
                               <DIV id=3Dygrp-text>
                       =
         <DIV>
                                <DIV>Fascinating! I've had t=
his idea that the 
                                EVP are often not r=
ecorded by the 
                                microphone but somehow make=
 their way in at the 
                                actual point whe=
re the storage is made, 
                                whether it be anal=
og (tape) or 
                                digital. <BR></DIV>
    =
                            <DIV>So much we don't know ...</DIV>
          =
                      <DIV> </DIV>
                                <DI=

           <DIV>
                                <DIV>I am curious if anyon=
e with a microphone

                                <DIV> </DIV>
                      =
          <DIV>I took part in an investigation 
                 =

          =

     =
                           all was being monitored and 
              =

          =

       =
                         conected to the central location. I wonder what 
 =
                               we might have heard if we did?</DIV>
